intro: Ixonanthes beccarii, commonly known as the African snowball, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered white flowers that resemble snowballs. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. Ixonanthes beccarii is adapted to nutrient-poor soils and is often found in coastal or sandy environments.
